Korean: 엄청나게 좋은 소식이 있어. 빨리 너에게 공유하고 싶어.
English: I have great news. I want to share it with you so much.

Korean: 네가 기뻐하니까 뭔가 엄청나게 좋은 소식인 것 같다.
English: You look so happy. It must be great news.

Korean: 우리가 예약한 호텔에 엄청 맛있는 뷔페가 있는데, 호텔 숙박객은 50% 할인이래.
English: There is a super delicious buffet in the hotel we reserved, and those who stay at the hotel get a 50 percent discount.

Korean: 정말? 지금 당장 가서 예약하자. 50% 할인이면 너무 파격적인 조건이야.
English: Is that true? Let's make a reservation right away. A 50 percent discount is a shocking offer.

Korean: 보내준 식당들을 보여주었더니, 3번째 식당이 제일 가고 싶다고 하셨어.
English: I showed them the restaurants you sent me and they preferred the third restaurant the most.

Korean: 외국인이 가장 선호하는 식당이래. 아무래도 음식이 한국적이라서 궁금해하는 것 같아.
English: It's the most preferred one by foreigners. The food is very Korean so they are probably curious.

Korean: 응. 그런데 듣기로는 빨리 예약해야 한다고 해서, 혹시 너 그 식당 번호를 아니?
English: Right. I heard that it is often fully booked, so do you have the phone number there?

Korean: 내가 보내준 식당 리스트에 적혀있을 거야. 한번 찾아봐. 없으면 다시 연락해줘.
English: It must be written on the restaurant list I sent you. Look for it on the list. If you can't find it, call me again.

Korean: 아무래도 오늘 가기로 한 식당은 취소해야 할 것 같아.
English: I think we have to cancel today's reservation we made at the restaurant.

Korean: 갑자기 무슨 일로? 내가 이번 주를 얼마나 기대했는데.
English: Why? I was so much looking forward to it.

Korean: 내가 장염이 너무 심하게 걸렸어. 어제도 온종일 병원에서 있었어.
English: I have severe enteritis. I stayed all day at the hospital yesterday as well.

Korean: 그랬구나. 많이 심각하니? 네가 빨리 나았으면 좋겠어.
English: I see. Is it really serious? Hope you get better soon.

Korean: 혹시 예약한 식당에 아기를 위한 의자나 식기류가 있을까?
English: Would there be chairs and dishware for babies at the restaurant we booked?

Korean: 글쎄. 그것까지 물어보지는 않았어. 지금 전화해볼까?
English: Well, I didn't ask that. Shall I call and ask?

Korean: 아냐. 내가 물어볼게. 있어야 우리가 편하게 먹을 수 있을 것 같아서.
English: Nah, I will make the call. I think we would be comfortable with them.

Korean: 응. 한번 물어봐. 그리고 차라리 방으로 달라고 하면 더 좋을 것 같아.
English: Yeah, go ahead. Or we better ask them to assign us a room.

Korean: 인원이 너무 많아서 아무래도 방을 2개로 나눠서 식당을 예약해야 할 것 같습니다.
English: We have two many people so we would better split the people into two groups and book two rooms.

Korean: 그래요? 그럼 차라리 다 같이 있을 수 있는 다른 장소가 좋지 않을까요?
English: Is that so? Then how about we find another place that can accommodate all of us in one place?

Korean: 그럼 다시 한번 알아보겠습니다. 아무래도 그런 곳은 고깃집이나 중식당밖에 없을 거예요.
English: Then, let me find another place. Barbeque houses and Chinese restaurants would be our only options, though.

Korean: 둘 중 다 같이 앉아서 먹을 수 있는 곳으로 알아봐 주세요.
English: Find one where all of us can sit and eat together.

Korean: 예약이 안 되어 있다는 말씀인가요? 분명 지난주에 4명 예약했습니다.
English: Do you mean that the reservation has not been made? I am sure I made a reservation for 4 people last week.

Korean: 죄송합니다. 아무래도 직원이 실수한 것 같습니다. 혹시 다른 시간대는 안되시나요?
English: I'm sorry. I think one of our staff members has made a mistake. Would any other time suit you?

Korean: 점심시간에 맞춰 예약한 것이니까 다른 시간대는 안되죠.
English: I made the reservation during our lunchtime so any other time would not work.

Korean: 혹시 괜찮으시다면 다음 주에 예약해 드려도 될까요? 대신 서비스 듬뿍 드리겠습니다.
English: If it's okay with you, could we make a reservation next week? We will provide you a lot of services instead.

Korean: 오늘 식당 예약이 몇 시라고 그랬지? 내가 몇 시까지 가면 되는 거니?
English: What time did you book the restaurant today? By what time should I go?

Korean: 저녁 7시에 예약했어. 6시 50분까지 오면 될 것 같아.
English: I booked it for 7 p.m. Come by 6:50.

Korean: 알겠어. 식당 앞에서 만날까? 아니면 내가 너 태우러 회사 앞으로 갈까?
English: Alright. Shall we meet in front of the restaurant? Or shall I pick you up at your office?

Korean: 나 잠시 병원 들렀다 가야 해서, 바로 식당 앞에서 만나는 게 좋을 것 같아.
English: I need to drop by the hospital, so let's meet at the restaurant.

Korean: 오늘 예약한 식당이 운영을 못 할 것 같다고 연락이 왔어.
English: The restaurant we booked for today just called me that they do not operate today.

Korean: 갑자기? 그럼 우리 예약은 어떻게 되는 거야?
English: All of a sudden? How about our reservation then?

Korean: 아무래도 다른 식당으로 예약해야 할 것 같아. 식당이 단수 상태래.
English: We should book another one. The water is cut off at the restaurant.

Korean: 그럼 어쩔 수 없지. 그렇다면 다른 식당 한번 새로 알아보자.
English: We can't help then. Let's find another restaurant.

Korean: 우리 주말마다 되게 자주 가던 식당 기억나니?
English: Do you remember the restaurant we used to go very often on the weekends?

Korean: 당연하지. 거기 방송에 나오고 되게 인기 많아졌다고 들었어.
English: Sure I do. I heard that it has become a lot popular after it went on air.

Korean: 응. 그래서 2호점이 생겼대. 오늘 한번 예약해서 같이 가볼래?
English: Yes, that's why they opened their second store. Shall we reserve a table today and visit?

Korean: 너무 좋지. 지금 당장 예약하자. 나는 거기 음식이 제일 좋은 것 같아.
English: I love it. Let's book it right away. I like the food there the best.

Korean: 오늘 예약한 식당이 정말 유명한 곳이야. 요리사가 세계적으로 유명한 사람이래.
English: The restaurant I booked today is a really famous one. The chef is world-famous.

Korean: 정말? 어쩐지 입구부터 범상치 않은 느낌이 들었어.
English: Really? That's why even the entrance looked extraordinary.

Korean: 맞아. 가서 추천 메뉴 맛있게 먹고 오자. 맛있는 음식 먹는 것만큼 행복한 순간은 없지.
English: Right. Let's go and enjoy the chef's recommendation. There is no happier moment than eating delicious food.

Korean: 너무 공감하는 사실이야. 나는 스트레스 받으면 맛있는 음식을 먹어.
English: I can't agree more. I enjoy delicious food when I get stressed.

Korean: 오늘 가는 식당 예약했어? 지금 전화해서 예약하자.
English: Did you reserve the restaurant we are going to go today? Let's make a call now and make a reservation.

Korean: 거기 인터넷 예약 가능해. 그냥 인터넷으로 쉽게 예약할 수 있다고 들었어.
English: Online reservation is available. I heard that we can easily make a reservation online.

Korean: 정말? 그렇다면 너무 편안하다. 사실 전화로 예약하는 거 너무 귀찮았거든.
English: Really? That is so convenient. In fact, I found it so bothersome to make a reservation by phone call.

Korean: 응. 사이트 들어가면 예약도 가능하고 예약 현황도 확인할 수 있대.
English: Yes, you can make a reservation and check the reservation status on the website.

Korean: 이번에 집 앞에 새로운 식당이 생겼던데, 봤니?
English: A new restaurant opened in front of our place now. Did you see it?

Korean: 응. 새로 생겨서 그런지 행사를 크게 진행하고 있더라. 장바구니를 공짜로 나눠주던데.
English: Yes, because it's newly opened, the restaurant is holding a large event. It is giving away shopping baskets for free.

Korean: 정말? 그럼 오늘 한번 거기 가볼래? 가서 음식 먹어보자.
English: Really? How about we go there today? Let's try their food.

Korean: 그런데 사람이 워낙 많아서 예약해야 할 거야.
English: Yeah, but we'll have to make a reservation because there are so many people.

Korean: 어제 방송에 나온 맛집 우리 동네 근처인 거 알아?
English: Do you know the restaurant that went on air yesterday is close to our neighborhood?

Korean: 정말? 어쩐지 입구나 도로가 익숙해 보였어.
English: Really? That's why the entrance and the road looked familiar.

Korean: 너 오늘 시간 괜찮으면 나랑 같이 먹으러 갈래? 내가 예약을 했거든.
English: If you have time today, how about we go together? I made a reservation.

Korean: 나야 너무 좋지. 그럼 오늘 퇴근하고 바로 그 식당으로 갈게.
English: I am glad to hear that. Then, I will go to the restaurant as soon as I get off.

Korean: 안녕하세요. 오늘 8명 예약했는데 1명이 더 올 것 같습니다.
English: Hello, I made a reservation for 8 people, but it seems one more is coming.

Korean: 죄송하지만 9명이 들어갈 수 있는 방은 없어요. 혹시 그냥 의자 자리로 드려도 될까요?
English: I'm sorry but we have no room that can hold 9 people. Is it okay if we just provide a place with chairs?

Korean: 의자 자리는 불편해서요. 혹시 그럼 두 팀으로 나눠서 방으로 할 수 있을까요?
English: The chairs would be uncomfortable. Shall we then split in two teams and reserve two rooms?

Korean: 일단 예약 현황을 보고 말씀드릴게요. 2시간 이내로 전화드리겠습니다.
English: Then, let me check the reservation status and call you within two hours.

Korean: 보내주신 자료 잘 봤습니다. 너무 큰 도움이 될 것 같아요.
English: The data you sent me would be a great help. Thank you so much.

Korean: 별말씀을요. 도움이 되었다니 제가 더 영광입니다.
English: You are welcome. It is an honor that it helped you.

Korean: 혹시 괜찮으시다면 제가 오늘 저녁에 식사 대접해도 될까요?
English: If you are okay, could I treat you to dinner today?

Korean: 저는 너무 영광입니다. 그럼 예약하신 식당 주소 보내주세요.
English: I am so honored. Then, please send me the restaurant address.

Korean: 오늘따라 예약한 손님이 많은 것 같아요. 무슨 날인가요?
English: It seems there are more reservations than usual today. Is it a special day today?

Korean: 오늘 아마 중학교랑 고등학교 졸업식이라서 사람들이 많을 거야.
English: It's graduation day for middle and high schools, so there are probably many people.

Korean: 그래서 사람이 많군요. 어쩐지 꽃다발을 많이 들고 다니더라고요.
English: That's why. No wonder I saw many bouquets today.

Korean: 졸업식은 좋은 날이고, 식당에서 축하하는 모습을 보면 덩달아 뿌듯해요.
English: Graduation day is a good day, and I feel happy to see them celebrate at restaurants.

Korean: 여기서 어제 선풍기를 샀는데 회전이 안 되네요.
English: I bought a fan here yesterday, but the rotate function does not work.

Korean: 자동 회전 버튼을 누르시면 좌우로 회전이 됩니다.
English: It rotates left and right when you press the auto-rotate button.

Korean: 버튼을 눌러도 돌아가지 않아요.
English: It doesn't rotate even when the button is pressed.

Korean: 상품을 직접 봐야 할 것 같군요. 들고 올 수 있나요?
English: I think I need to look at the product in person. Can you bring it in?

Korean: 휴대전화를 산 지 한 달밖에 안 됐는데 벌써 속도가 느려요.
English: I only bought this cellphone one month ago and it already is slow.

Korean: 애플리케이션을 과도하게 설치하면 느릴 수 있습니다.
English: It can become slow if you install too many applications.

Korean: 많이 다운로드하지 않았는데도 그렇네요.
English: It's like this even though I didn't download a lot.

Korean: A/S를 받아야 할 것 같네요.
English: It looks like you need to have it serviced.

Korean: 조카 선물로 옷을 구매했는데 크기가 작네요.
English: I bought clothes as a present for my nephew, but the size is too small.

Korean: 큰 사이즈로 바꿔드릴까요?
English: Should I exchange it for a larger size?

Korean: 한 사이즈 크게 주세요. 그리고 포장도 부탁드릴게요.
English: Please give me a size larger. Also, gift wrap it, please.

Korean: 알겠습니다. 영수증 한 번 보여주세요,
English: Ok. Please show me your receipt.

Korean: 조립식 가구를 구매했는데 상자 안에 따로 나사가 없더군요.
English: I bought self-assembly furniture but there are no screws inside the box.

Korean: 투명 봉투에 나사와 설명서가 같이 있는데 다시 한번 확인해주세요.
English: Please check again as the screws are in a clear plastic bag with the manual.

Korean: 그 안에 설명서만 있었어요.
English: Only the manual was in there.

Korean: 포장하는 과정에서 실수가 있었나 봅니다. 나사 따로 챙겨서 집으로 보내드리겠습니다.
English: It looks like there was a mistake during the packaging process. We'll send the screws separately to your home.

Korean: 저희 딸이 유통기한이 지난 우유를 사 왔더군요.
English: Our daughter bought milk that was expired.

Korean: 저희 매장에는 유통기한이 지난 물품은 판매하고 있지 않습니다.
English: This store doesn't sell products past their expiration dates.

Korean: 여기 물품과 영수증 확인해보세요.
English: Please check the product and the receipt.

Korean: 해당 물품은 저희 매장이 아니라 건너편에 있는 편의점에서 구매하셨네요.
English: This product was not purchased at our store but in the convenience store across the street.

Korean: 어제 새로 사 준 헤드폰에서 소리가 안 들려.
English: I can't hear any sound from the new headphones you bought me yesterday.

Korean: 설명서 읽어봤어? 내가 살 때 직원이 소리를 켰다가 끌 수 있다고 들었어.
English: Did you read the instructions? When I was purchasing it, I heard from the employee that the sound can be turned on and off.

Korean: 설명서대로 해봤지만, 소리가 안 들려.
English: I followed the instructions, but I can't hear any sound.

Korean: 판매한 매장에 다시 들고 가서 물어봐야겠어.
English: We should take it back to the store that sold it and ask them.

Korean: 새로 산 스팀다리미 어때?
English: How is the new steam iron you bought?

Korean: 다리미는 좋은 데 같이 있던 다리미판에 결함이 있는 것 같아.
English: The iron is good but the ironing board that came with it seems defective.

Korean: 무슨 일인데?
English: What's wrong?

Korean: 다리미판이 고정이 안 돼.
English: The ironing board can't be fixed to the ground.

Korean: 내 방에 에어컨이 새로 생겼어. 얼른 잘 되는지 확인해보자!
English: I have a new air conditioner in my room. Let's check to see if it works without any problems!

Korean: 전원 버튼 눌렀는데 바람 잘 나오니?
English: I pressed the power button. Is the air coming out?

Korean: 아니. 뜨거운 바람 나오는데?
English: No. Hot air is coming out.

Korean: 조금만 기다려보고 이상하면 설치 기사 다시 부르자.
English: Let's wait a little and if it still has a problem, let's call the installation technician again.

Korean: 독서실에서 마우스 소리가 많이 나서 소음이 없는 마우스로 새로 구매했어.
English: I bought a silent computer mouse because there was a lot of noise from my previous one when I was in the study room.

Korean: 정말 소음이 없어? 작동 잘 돼?
English: Is it really noise-less? Does it work?

Korean: 지금 처음 써보는 데 버튼 소리가 생각보다 많이 나는데?
English: I am using it for the first time, but there is more noise than I expected.

Korean: 그렇네. 판매처에 문의해보자.
English: You're right. Let's contact the seller.

Korean: 삼성 서비스센터입니다. 무슨 문제 있으신가요?
English: This is the #Samsung# service center. What issue are you having?

Korean: 김치냉장고에 온도 조절이 안 되어서 김치가 벌써 익었어요.
English: My kimchi has already been fermented because the temperature setting is not working in my kimchi refrigerator.

Korean: 죄송합니다. 지금 바로 수리 기사 보내겠습니다.
English: I'm sorry. We'll send a repair technician right away.

Korean: 오는 데 얼마나 걸리나요?
English: How long will it take for them to come?

Korean: 이것 좀 봐봐. TV 채널이 이상해.
English: Take a look at this. Something is wrong with the TV channel.

Korean: 어제까지만 해도 괜찮았는데?
English: It was fine just yesterday.

Korean: 다른 건 괜찮은 데 채널 6번만 안 돼.
English: The other channels are fine, but only channel 6 is not working.

Korean: 이상하네. 내가 한 번 살펴보고 안되면 전화하자.
English: That is strange. I will take a look and if I can't fix it, let's make a call.

Korean: 손목시계를 새로 샀는데 작동이 안 되네. 시간이 멈춰있어.
English: I bought a new wristwatch, but it doesn't work. The time has stopped.

Korean: 일주일 전에 사지 않았어? 약이 다 됐나 봐.
English: Didn't you buy it a week ago? It looks like the batteries have run out.

Korean: 직접 매장에 들고 가 봐야겠어.
English: I should take it to the store.

Korean: 그래야 할 것 같아. 교체가 필요할 것 같아.
English: It looks like you have to. I think you need to have it replaced.

Korean: 체온계를 80,000원 주고 샀는데 측정이 안 되는 건 말이 안 되는 일이야!
English: I bought this thermometer for 80,000 won, but it's nonsense that it's not working!

Korean: 혹시 체온계 커버를 안 끼우고 한 거 아니야?
English: Perhaps you tried it without attaching the thermometer cover?

Korean: 당연히 했지. 그러면 다시 해보자.
English: Of course, I did. Then let's try it again.

Korean: 새로 했는데도 안 되네. 판매처에 들고 가보자.
English: It didn't work even though we tried again. Let's try taking it back to the seller.

Korean: 정확히 반찬 무게를 측정해서 요리하려고 저울을 구매했어.
English: I bought a scale to cook while measuring the exact weight of side dishes.

Korean: 좋은 생각이야. 그런데 기준이 0이 아니네?
English: That's a good idea. But the scale is not set at 0.

Korean: 아까 매장에서는 괜찮았는데? 그럼 내가 다시 맞추면 되지.
English: It was fine at the store a minute ago. I can just set it again.

Korean: 어디에 맞추는 게 있어? 조절하는 게 보이지 않네.
English: How can you set it? I don’t see any adjustment controls.

Korean: 정수기에서 물비린내가 나요. 어떻게 해야 하나요?
English: There is a fishy smell in the water purifier. What should I do?

Korean: 정수기 필터 교체가 필요할 것 같군요.
English: It looks like you need to replace the water purifier filter.

Korean: 필터는 직접 사서 해야 하나요?
English: Do I need to buy and replace it myself?

Korean: 일단 정수기 내부를 열어본 후 문제가 있는 필터를 확인해야 해요. 그 후에 맞는 제품을 구매하시면 됩니다.
English: First, you need to open the water purifier to check for the problematic filter. Then you can purchase the correct product.

Korean: 아이 책가방을 여기서 샀는데 문제가 생겼어요.
English: I bought a children's backpack here and a problem occurred.

Korean: 어제 사가셨던 손님이군요! 색상이 마음에 들지 않아 하던가요?
English: You are the customer who bought it yesterday! Didn't they like the color?

Korean: 아니요. 가방 내부에 확인해보니 천이 찢어져 있었어요.
English: It's not that. When I looked inside the bag, the fabric was ripped.

Korean: 죄송합니다. 그럼 새 제품으로 교환해드릴게요.
English: I'm sorry. I'll exchange it for a new one.

Korean: 미술 시간에 이용할 붓 세트를 샀는데 이것 좀 보세요.
English: I bought this set of brushes for art class. Please take a look at this.

Korean: 제가 보기에는 이상이 없어 보입니다.
English: There doesn't seem to be anything wrong to me.

Korean: 모가 허술해서 물에 적시면 다 뽑히네요.
English: The hairs are weak, so they fall out when they get wet.

Korean: 제가 몰랐던 부분이네요. 환불해 드리겠습니다.
English: I didn't know that. I will give you a refund.

Korean: 은팔찌를 구매했는데 새까맣게 됐어요.
English: I bought a silver bracelet, but it turned black.

Korean: 은은 공기 중에 노출되면 색이 변합니다. 특수 세척액을 이용하면 색이 돌아옵니다.
English: Silver changes color when exposed to the air. The color comes back if you use special cleaning fluids.

Korean: 여기서 세척은 안 되나요?
English: Can the cleaning be done here?

Korean: 특별히 오늘은 해드리겠습니다.
English: I'll make an exception and do it today.

Korean: 달력을 샀는데 이것 좀 보세요. 넘겨보다가 확인했어요.
English: I bought a calendar and look at it. I found this while turning the pages.

Korean: 4월 다음에 또 4월이 있군요. 그다음에 바로 6월이네요.
English: There is another April after April. Then it goes straight to June.

Korean: 그냥 쓰려다가 불편해서 다시 왔습니다.
English: I thought of using it as it is, but I came back because it was inconvenient.

Korean: 죄송합니다. 인쇄하는 과정에서 실수가 있었나 봅니다.
English: I'm sorry. It looks like there was a mistake in the printing process.

Korean: 제 구찌 지갑 혹시 수리되나요? 가죽이 늘어나서 보기에 불편하네요.
English: Can my #Gucci# wallet be repaired? The leather has stretched so it is hard to look at.

Korean: 혹시 한 칸에 카드 여러 장 넣으셨나요?
English: Did you by chance put many cards in 1 compartment?

Korean: 카드 자리가 부족해서 한 칸에 두 장씩 넣었어요.
English: There wasn't enough space for my cards, so I put two cards in each compartment.

Korean: 죄송하지만 가죽은 따로 수리가 안 되네요.
English: I am sorry but separate repairs cannot be made for leather.

Korean: 과자를 먹다가 발견했어요. 있을 수 있는 일인가요?
English: I found this while eating this snack. How can this happen?

Korean: 혹시 아이들이 장난치다가 넣은 건 아닐까요?
English: Could it be that the children put it in there as a joke?

Korean: 그럼 저희가 거짓말한다는 거예요? 배앓이 하면 고소할 거에요.
English: Are you then saying that we're lying? I'll sue you if I get a upset stomach

Korean: 저희 측 문제인지 확인하기 위해서 제품을 회수해야 할 것 같습니다.
English: I think we'll need to retrieve the product to see if there was a problem on our end.

Korean: 휴대전화 배터리 소모가 빨라요. 휴대전화에 이상이 있는 건가요?
English: The battery runs down quickly on my cellphone. Is there something wrong with the cellphone?

Korean: 확인해보니 휴대전화 배터리 교체가 필요합니다.
English: After checking it,  I found that the cellphone battery needs to be replaced.

Korean: 새 배터리 교체 비용은 어떻게 되나요?
English: What is the cost to replace it with a new battery?

Korean: 25,000원입니다. 교체하면 문제가 없을 겁니다.
English: It's 25,000 won. There should be no problems after it has been replaced.

Korean: 보온병에 따뜻한 차를 담았는데 보온이 안 되네요.
English: I filled the thermos with hot tea, but it doesn't stay warm.

Korean: 언제 구매하셨나요? 제품명도 알려주세요.
English: When did you buy it? Please also tell me the product name.

Korean: 2주 전에 구매했고, JNL-503K입니다.
English: I bought it 2 weeks ago, and it's JNL-503K.

Korean: 본사에 연락해서 문제점을 확인해본 후 전화로 연락드려도 될까요?
English: Can I call you back after I contact the head office to check for issues?

Korean: 새로 산 형광펜이 색깔이 안 나와.
English: The ink doesn't come out on this new highlighter pen I bought.

Korean: 나한테 똑같은 색상 있는데 이거 쓸래?
English: I have the same color. Do you want to use this?

Korean: 고마워. 문구점에 가서 얘기해봐야겠다.
English: Thank you. I should go to the stationery shop to talk about this.

Korean: 수업 끝나고 집에 갈 때 돌려주면 돼.
English: You can give it back to me when you go home after class.

Korean: 노트북 충전이 안 되는 데 서비스 센터에 가야 하지?
English: The laptop is not charging so I should take it to the servicing center, right?

Korean: 오전에 가면 빨리 수리받을 수 있을 거야.
English: If you go before noon, you should be able to get it repaired quickly.

Korean: 당장 과제 있는데 큰일 났네.
English: This is a big problem because there is an assignment I need to do now.

Korean: 도서관에 가서 신청하면 컴퓨터 하루에 3시간 무료로 이용할 수 있어.
English: If you go to the library and make a request, you can borrow a computer for free for 3 hours a day.

Korean: 음료수 환불이 가능할까요?
English: Is it possible to get a refund for this drink?

Korean: 무슨 문제가 있으십니까?
English: What seems to be the problem?

Korean: 음료수 입구에 시꺼멓게 곰팡이가 핀 것처럼 새까맣네요.
English: The opening part of this drink is black as if black mold has grown there.

Korean: 죄송합니다. 영수증과 결제하신 카드 주시면 환불 도와드리겠습니다.
English: I'm sorry. If you give me your receipt and the credit card used to pay for it, I'll issue a refund for you.

Korean: 태어날 아기를 위해서 옷을 샀는데 좀 더 큰 사이즈로 교환 가능할까요?
English: I bought clothes for my unborn baby, but can I exchange them for a bigger size?

Korean: 이 옷이면 적당할 거 같은데요?
English: This clothing seems appropriate.

Korean: 선물 받은 옷이 많아서 좀 더 컸을 때 입히려고 사이즈 교환하고 싶어요.
English: I have a lot of clothes that I received as gifts, so I want to change it for a bigger size so the baby can wear it later.

Korean: 그럼 지금 옷보다 한 사이즈 크게 드리면 될까요?
English: Then would it be ok to give you one that is one size bigger than this one?

Korean: 파운데이션을 샀는데 색상이 저랑 맞지 않은 것 같아요.
English: I bought this foundation, but the color does not seem to suit me.

Korean: 테스트해보지 않았나요?
English: Didn't you test it?

Korean: 선물 받은 제품이 제 피부보다 너무 밝아요.
English: The product that I received as a gift is too bright for my skin.

Korean: 그러면 여기 앉아서 색상 테스트해보고 맞는 색상 바꿔가면 됩니다.
English: Then you can sit here to do a color test and exchange it for the correct color.

Korean: 선물 받은 텀블러 디자인이 마음에 안 들어서 교환하고 싶어요.
English: I would like to exchange this tumbler that I received as a gift because I don't like the design.

Korean: 영수증 같이 가져오셨나요?
English: Did you bring the receipt?

Korean: 여기 있습니다. 아무 제품으로 교환 가능합니까?
English: Here it is. Can I exchange it for any product?

Korean: 제품보다 비싼 가격은 추가 비용을 지불하셔야 합니다.
English: Additional costs need to be paid for prices that are more expensive than the product.

Korean: 종합영양제를 구매했는데 제 것을 남성용으로 구매했습니다. 교환되나요?
English: I bought multi-vitamins for myself, but I bought ones for men. Can it be exchanged?

Korean: 가능합니다. 영수증 가지고 계십니까?
English: You can. Did you bring the receipt?

Korean: 여기 있습니다. 가격은 남녀구분 없이 똑같은가요?
English: It is right here. Is the price the same regardless of gender?

Korean: 같습니다. 교환한 제품을 봉투에 담아드렸습니다.
English: It's the same. I have put the exchanged product in a bag for you.

Korean: 액정 보호필름을 구매했는데 깨진 상태로 왔어요. 교환해주세요.
English: I bought a protective film for my display, but it came broken. Please exchange it.

Korean: 확인을 위해 사진을 찍어서 제 휴대전화 번호로 보내주시겠어요?
English: Could you take a picture for confirmation and send it to my mobile phone?

Korean: 지금 바로 보내드릴게요.
English: I'll send it right now.

Korean: 배송된 주소로 다시 보내드리겠습니다. 배송 시작하면 연락드릴게요.
English: I will send it again to the address it was delivered to. I will contact you when we start shipping.

Korean: 이불 사이즈를 측정 안 하고 샀더니 실수를 했어요. 혹시 교환되나요?
English: I made a mistake when I bought this without measuring my blanket size. Can it be exchanged?

Korean: 구매하신 지 며칠 되셨나요?
English: How long has it been since you bought it?

Korean: 3일밖에 안 되었어요.
English: It has only been 3 days.

Korean: 제품의 흔적을 확인하고 이상 없으면 교환 도와드리겠습니다.
English: I'll check for any marks on the product and will exchange it for you if there are no issues.

Korean: 청소기 필터를 교체하려고 새로 샀는데 잘못 샀네요. 교환하고 싶어요.
English: I bought a new filter to replace my vacuum cleaner filter, but I bought the wrong one. I want to exchange it.

Korean: 다음에는 직원에게 청소기 이름을 알려주면 바로 찾아드립니다.
English: Next time if you tell our employee the model of the vacuum cleaner, they will find it for you right away.

Korean: 알겠습니다. 바꿔주신다니 고맙군요.
English: I understand. Thank you for exchanging it.

Korean: 별말씀을요. 혹시 이상 있으면 찾아오세요.
English: No problem. Please come back if you have any problems.

Korean: 패딩을 구매한 지 일주일도 안 돼서 털이 엄청나게 빠져나와요. 어떻게 해야 하나요?
English: It hasn't even been a week since I bought this padded jacket and already a lot of feathers are coming out. What should I do?

Korean: 말씀대로 옷이 많이 상했군요. 특별히 저희가 새 상품으로 교환해드리겠습니다.
English: As you said, the clothing is very distressed. We'll exchange it for a new product this time.

Korean: 감사합니다. 혹시 이번에도 털이 많이 빠지면 어떻게 하나요?
English: Thank you. What should I do if a lot of feathers come out again this time?

Korean: 이상 있으면 일주일 내로 연락 바랍니다.
English: Please contact us within a week if you have any problems.

Korean: 주문한 컵이 도착했는데 모두 금이 가 있어요. 환불 부탁드려요.
English: The cups I ordered have arrived, but they are all cracked. I would like a refund.

Korean: 저희가 보낼 때는 이상이 없었는데 사진 찍어서 보여주실 수 있나요?
English: There was no problem when we sent them, so could you take a photo and send it to us?

Korean: 메일로 보내드렸어요.
English: I sent it to you by email.

Korean: 택배 기사가 다시 제품을 받으러 갈 거예요. 다시 포장 부탁드릴게요.
English: The delivery man will come back to collect the product. Please pack it up again.

Korean: 휴대전화 케이스 색상이 인터넷에서 봤던 것보다 별로예요. 색상 바꾸고 싶어요.
English: The color of the cellphone case is not the same as the one I saw on the internet. I would like to change the colors.

Korean: 색상 변경은 단순 변심이라 택배비가 추가됩니다.
English: Color changes are considered simply changing your mind, so there will be an additional delivery charge.

Korean: 괜찮습니다. 색상은 검은색으로 주세요.
English: That is ok. Please send me a black one.

Korean: 5일 정도 소요될 것 같습니다.
English: It looks like it will take about 5 days.

Korean: 주문한 가구가 생각보다 늦네요. 앞으로 더 걸리면 환불하고 싶어요.
English: The furniture I ordered is coming later than I expected. If it takes any longer, I would like a refund.

Korean: 고객님이 주문하신 가구는 제작이 완료되어 내일 오전에 출발할 것 같습니다.
English: The manufacture of the furniture you ordered has been completed and it will begin delivery tomorrow before noon.

Korean: 제작 상품이라고 하지만 기다리다가 지치네요.
English: I know it's custom-made, but I am tired of waiting.

Korean: 오랫동안 기다리게 해드려 죄송합니다.
English: We're sorry you had to wait so long.

Korean: 여기 티셔츠는 다른 곳보다 사이즈가 크게 나오는 것 같네요. 교환할 수 있을까요?
English: It looks like the T-shirts sizes here are larger than other places. Can I exchange this?

Korean: 네. 가능합니다. 현재 사이즈가 90인데 85로 바꿔드릴까요?
English: Yes, you can. The current size is 90 so should I change it to an 85?

Korean: 감사합니다. 바지도 사이즈가 크게 나오나요?
English: Thank you. Are the sizes of your pants large as well?

Korean: 바지는 정 사이즈로 보시면 됩니다.
English: Pants sizes are true to size.

Korean: 흰색 티셔츠가 비침이 심해서 환불받고 싶어요.
English: This white T-shirt is too sheer so I would like a refund.

Korean: 죄송하지만 여기 립스틱이 묻어 있어서 환불, 교환이 불가합니다.
English: We are sorry but we are not able to refund or exchange this as there is lipstick on it.

Korean: 제가 확인해봐도 될까요?
English: Can I check it?

Korean: 목 옆에 묻어 있는 거 보이시나요?
English: Do you see the stain on the side of the neck?

Korean: 새로 산 책 안에 프린팅이 제대로 안 되어 있어요. 교환해주세요.
English: There is a problem with the printing in this new book I bought. Please exchange it for me.

Korean: 죄송합니다. 바로 새 제품으로 교환해드릴게요.
English: I'm sorry. I'll exchange it for a new one right away.

Korean: 잘못된 부분이 없는지 확인해보고 갈게요.
English: I'll check to see if anything is wrong before I leave.

Korean: 확인해보고 이상 있으면 말씀해주세요.
English: Please check and tell us if there are any issues.

Korean: 고양이 집을 샀는데 직접 조립해야 하는지 몰랐어요. 환불하고 싶어요.
English: I bought a cat house, but I didn't know I had to assemble it myself. I would like to get a refund.

Korean: 제작 상품이기 때문에 이상이 없으면 환불이 어렵습니다.
English: We are not able to refund this product unless it has issues because it is a product made to order.

Korean: 교환도 안 되나요?
English: Can I not even exchange it?

Korean: 죄송합니다. 하지만 조립하는 데 어렵지 않습니다.
English: I'm sorry, but it's not difficult to assemble.

Korean: 블루투스 마이크가 계속 연결이 안 돼요. 교환해주세요.
English: This Bluetooth microphone doesn't connect. Please exchange it.

Korean: 현재 해당 상품은 재고가 없어 교환이 어렵습니다.
English: Currently, we do not have this product in stock so an exchange would not be possible.

Korean: 고장 난 제품을 쓸 수 없어요. 환불해주세요.
English: I can't use a broken product. Please issue me a refund.

Korean: 알겠습니다. 3일 내로 환불해드리겠습니다.
English: I understand. We will give you a refund within 3 days.

Korean: 잠옷을 샀는데 잘못 고른 것 같아요. 교환할 수 있나요?
English: I bought pajamas but I think I made the wrong choice. Can I exchange it?

Korean: 직접 입어보셨나요?
English: Did you try putting it on?

Korean: 입지 않았습니다. 보시다시피 포장지가 깨끗하잖아요.
English: I didn't wear it. As you can see the packaging is clean.

Korean: 해당 상품을 진열대에서 가지고 오면 교환해드리겠습니다.
English: If you bring the item to the display counter, we'll exchange it for you.

Korean: 강의를 위해서 산 빔프로젝터가 고장이 났어요. 교환해주세요.
English: The beam projector that I bought to lecture not working. Please exchange it for me.

Korean: 교환은 안 되고 수리가 가능합니다.
English: We cannot exchange it, but we can repair it.

Korean: 당장 내일 사용해야 하는데 다른 방법 없을까요?
English: Is there another way because I need to use it tomorrow?

Korean: 최대한 오늘 고칠 수 있도록 문의해드릴게요.
English: I will ask if we can get it fixed by today if possible.

Korean: 얇은 A4용지를 샀더니 깨끗하게 인쇄가 안 되네요. 사용하지 않은 새 제품은 환불해주세요.
English: My printing is not clean after I bought the thin A4 papers. Please refund the new products that I have not used.

Korean: 저희 가게는 환불을 현금으로 해드리지 않고 매장에서 사용 가능한 포인트로 돌려드려요.
English: Our store does not refund in cash but gives you points that you can use in the store.

Korean: 현금으로 받고 싶은데 방법이 없을까요?
English: I would like to get a refund in cash. Is there any way to do that?

Korean: 회사 방침상 어려울 것 같습니다.
English: It would be difficult because of our company policy.

Korean: 컴퓨터 책상과 의자를 주문했는데 의자가 불편하네요. 교환하고 싶어요.
English: I ordered a computer desk and chair, but the chair is uncomfortable. I would like to exchange it.

Korean: 어떤 점이 불편하신가요?
English: Which part was uncomfortable?

Korean: 등받이가 없어서 장시간 앉기 힘들어요.
English: It doesn't have a backrest, so it is difficult to sit on it for extended periods.

Korean: 그럼 책자에 있는 B 상품으로 교환하는 건 어떤가요?
English: Then how about exchanging it with product B in the booklet?

Korean: 딸이 선물해 준 립스틱 색상이 마음에 안 들어요. 다른 색상으로 바꿀 수 있나요?
English: I don’t like the color of the lipstick that my daughter gave me as a present. Can I change it for a different color?

Korean: 사용하지 않았다면 가능합니다.
English: You can if it is unused.

Korean: 한 번도 사용하지 않았습니다. 확인해보세요.
English: I didn't use it even once. Please check the product.

Korean: 깨끗하네요. 진열된 립스틱 색상 구경하시고, 마음에 드는 색상 있으면 알려주세요.
English: It's clean. Please take a look at the lipstick colors displayed and let me know if there is a color you like.

Korean: 크로스백을 주문했는데 숄더백이 도착했어요. 환불해주세요.
English: I ordered a cross-bag, but I received a shoulder bag. I would like a refund.

Korean: 죄송합니다. 크로스백으로 다시 보내드릴까요?
English: I'm sorry. Should we send you a cross-bag instead?

Korean: 기다렸던 제품이 다른 제품으로 온 걸 보니 실망스럽네요. 사용하고 싶지 않아요.
English: I'm disappointed to see that the product other than the one I expected was delivered. I don't want to use it.

Korean: 불편하게 해드렸네요. 죄송합니다.
English: We're sorry for the inconvenience. We apologize.

Korean: 피아노를 샀는데 소리 들어보시겠어요? 환불해주세요.
English: I bought a piano here, but could you please listen to it? I want a refund.

Korean: 원래 해당 제품은 디지털 사운드가 납니다.
English: This product is supposed to make digital sounds.

Korean: 저는 디지털 제품을 주문하지 않았어요. 주문 확인과정에서 실수가 있었나 보군요.
English: I didn't order a digital product. I think there must have been a mistake in the order confirmation process.

Korean: 제가 다시 확인하고 연락드려도 될까요?
English: Can I call you back after I double-check?

Korean: 양산을 구매했는데 접이식이 아니네요. 교환될까요?
English: I bought a parasol, but it's not a folding type. Can I exchange it?

Korean: 가능하지만 추가 금액이 요구됩니다.
English: You can but an additional cost is required.

Korean: 괜찮아요. 휴대용이 더 편할 거 같아서 바꾸고 싶어요.
English: That's ok. I want to exchange it as the portable type seems more convenient.

Korean: 2층 에스컬레이터 옆에 보면 종류가 여러 가지 있습니다.
English: There are many types if you go look next to the escalator on the 2nd floor.

Korean: 에어팟을 사고 싶은데 재고가 남아있나요?
English: I want to buy an #Airpod#. Is there any in stock?

Korean: 죄송하지만 현재 상품이 동나고 입고를 기다리고 있습니다.
English: We are sorry but current that product is sold out and we are waiting for it to be restocked.

Korean: 얼마나 기다려야 하나요?
English: How long would I have to wait?

Korean: 짧으면 일주일, 길게는 2주 기다려야 합니다.
English: You would have to wait one week at the very least, and 2 weeks at the most.

Korean: 얼마 전에 헤어드라이어 행사를 봤어요. 와인색 있나요?
English: I saw the hairdryer promotion you had recently. Are there any wine-colored ones left?

Korean: 현재 와인색은 재고가 없습니다. 검은색 2개 남아있어요.
English: Currently, we do not have the wine color in stock. There are 2 black colored ones available.

Korean: 입고 예정이 있나요?
English: Do you have plans to restock?

Korean: 행사 제품이라 입고는 언제 될지 모릅니다.
English: We do not know when it will be restocked as it was a promotional product.

Korean: 이번에 새로 나온 포켓몬 닌텐도를 사고 싶습니다.
English: I want to buy the newly released #Pokemon# #Nintendo#.

Korean: 현재 그 제품은 인기가 많아서 구하기 어렵습니다.
English: It's hard to get a hold of that product as it's so popular.

Korean: 혹시 근처 다른 매장에 재고가 남아있나요?
English: Is there any left in stock in other branches nearby?

Korean: 지금 전화해서 알아봐 드리겠습니다.
English: I will call them now and find out for you.

Korean: 다음 달에 화장품이 새롭게 바뀐다고 들었습니다. 바뀌기 전의 화장품을 사고 싶은데 있나요?
English: I heard that there will be a renewal in your cosmetics next month. I would like to buy the cosmetics before the renewal. Do you have them?

Korean: 지금 남아있는 것은 옆에 전시된 화장품이 끝입니다. 하지만 세일을 하고 있어요.
English: The last ones we have are the cosmetics displayed on your side. But it's on sale.

Korean: 제가 찾는 화장품이 있네요. 모두 결제해주세요.
English: These are the cosmetic products I was looking for. Please ring all these up.

Korean: 알겠습니다. 봉투 필요하신가요?
English: Ok. Do you need a bag?

Korean: 포켓몬 한정판 인형을 여기에서만 판다고 들었습니다. 재고가 남아있습니까?
English: I heard that the limited edition #Pokemon# dolls are only sold here. Do you have any in stock?

Korean: 어제 새로 입고되어 종류별로 가지고 있습니다.
English: They just came in yesterday, so we have every type.

Korean: 당장 가야겠군요. 언제까지 하나요?
English: I should go immediately. When are you open until?

Korean: 저녁 8시에 문을 닫습니다.
English: We close at 8 p.m.

Korean: 새로 나온 휴대전화 케이스가 인상적이더군요. 제 기종은 아이폰 8인데 있을까요?
English: The newly released cellphone case was very impressive. I use an #Iphone 8#, would there be one for me?

Korean: 죄송하지만 현재 남아있는 제품은 아이폰X 시리즈만 있습니다.
English: I'm sorry we only have ones for the #Iphone X# series.

Korean: 다른 곳에서도 구할 수 없나요?
English: Is there any place else I can get it?

Korean: 네. 언제 입고될지도 모릅니다.
English: No. We don't even know when the new stock will come in.

Korean: 지난주에 왔을 때 오늘 올리브색상의 매니큐어가 입고된다고 들었어요.
English: When I came last week, I heard that the olive color manicure would be in stock today.

Korean: 하루 지연되어 내일 입고됩니다.
English: There has been a 1-day delay so it will be in stock tomorrow.

Korean: 내일은 일이 있어서 못 올 것 같은데 예약은 안 되나요?
English: I don't think I can come tomorrow since I have something to do. Is it possible to reserve it?

Korean: 안타깝지만 찾는 고객이 많아 힘들 것 같습니다.
English: Unfortunately, it seems that would be difficult as there are a lot of customers asking for it.

Korean: #아리아나 그란데#가 착용한 가방이 여기 브랜드라는 말을 들었어요. 살 수 있을까요?
English: I heard the bag that #Ariana Grande# wore was from this brand. Can I buy it?

Korean: 죄송하지만 해당 제품은 재고가 없습니다.
English: I am sorry, but we don't have that product in stock.

Korean: 다른 경로로 구매할 수는 없을까요?
English: Is there a way to buy it through any other channels?

Korean: 개수가 한정되어 있어서 아마 다른 곳도 없을 거예요.
English: It's unlikely to be in other places as well because the number of this product is limited.

Korean: 지금 제가 가지고 있는 향과 똑같은 향수가 있나요?
English: Do you have a perfume with the same scent as the one I have?

Korean: 똑같지는 않고 비슷한 향이 있습니다.
English: We don't have the same one, but we have something similar.

Korean: 테스트해봐도 될까요? 똑같은 향 구하기가 어렵네요.
English: Can I try it? It's hard to find the same one.

Korean: 흔하지 않아서 그런 것 같군요.
English: It may be because it's not a common one.

Korean: 크리스마스를 기념해서 케이크를 포장하려고 합니다. 많이 남아있나요?
English: I would like to take-out a cake to celebrate Christmas. Are there still many available?

Korean: 오늘이 기념일이라서 케이크 주문이 많습니다. 빨리 오지 않으면 없을 것 같군요.
English: There are a lot of cake orders as today is a holiday. I don't think there will be any left if you don't come soon.

Korean: 지금은 못 가는 데 예약 가능한가요?
English: I can't go now but can I reserve one?

Korean: 가능합니다. 전화번호랑 이름 알려주세요.
English: You can. Please tell me your name and telephone number.

Korean: 작은 여행 가방이 있을까요? 집에 큰 여행 가방밖에 없어서요.
English: Do you have a small travel bag? I only have a large one at home.

Korean: 크기별로 다양하게 있습니다.
English: We have various bags by size.

Korean: 1층에는 안 보이는데 어디로 가야 하나요?
English: I can't see any on the 1st floor, where do I need to go?

Korean: 3층에 가시면 다양한 브랜드가 있습니다.
English: There are various brands available if you go to the 3rd floor.

Korean: 사람 크기만큼 큰 곰 인형이 있다고 해서 왔습니다. 어디에 있을까요?
English: I came because I heard there was a teddy bear that is big as a person. Where is it?

Korean: 갑자기 인터넷에서 유명해져서 저희 매장에는 재고가 없습니다.
English: We do not have any in our store as it suddenly became popular on the internet.

Korean: 구하기 어려울까요?
English: Would it be hard to find?

Korean: 약 2주 뒤면 매장에 있을 것 같으니 미리 연락해주세요.
English: I think we'll have some in-store in about 2 weeks, so please call us in advance.

Korean: 지난주에 산 귀걸이랑 똑같은 귀걸이가 있을까요? 사진 여기 있어요.
English: Would there be an earring just like the one I bought last week? Here is a picture.

Korean: 한 개 남아있어요. 여기 있군요.
English: There is one left. Here it is.

Korean: 예쁘다고 생각했는데 잃어버려서 다시 사러 왔어요.
English: I thought it was really pretty, but I lost it, so I came back to buy it again.

Korean: 운이 좋군요! 조금만 늦었으면 없었을 거예요.
English: You are lucky! If you came a little late, it would have been sold out.

Korean: 파스타 소스에는 이 제품이 맛있다고 하더군요. 여기에 판매한다고 들었어요.
English: They say that the pasta sauce from this brand is tasty. I heard they sold it here.

Korean: 인기가 많아서 계산대 근처로 위치를 옮겼어요.
English: We moved its location near the check-out as it was popular.

Korean: 여러 가지 종류가 있더군요. 특히 어느 소스가 인기가 많나요?
English: There seem to be many different types. Which sauce is especially popular?

Korean: 크림파스타 소스가 토마스 소스보다 잘나가요.
English: We sell more cream pasta sauces than tomato sauces.

Korean: 이 지역의 특산품은 명란젓이라고 들었어요. 여기에 있나요?
English: I heard that the local specialty in this region is a salted pollack roe. Do you have it here?

Korean: G 코너에 가면 냉장실에 보관된 명란젓이 있어요.
English: You can find salted pollack roe in the cooler if you go to section G.

Korean: 처음 먹어보는 건데 맛있나요?
English: This is my first time trying it Is it good?

Korean: 처음이니 시도해보는 것도 나쁘지 않은 것 같아요!
English: Since it's your first time, I don't think it's a bad idea to give it a try!

Korean: 키보드 소리가 많이 나서 위에 덮을 패드를 찾고 있어요.
English: I am looking for a pad to cover my keyboard as it makes too much noise.

Korean: 그 제품은 인터넷에서만 살 수 있어요.
English: You can only buy that product online.

Korean: 인터넷 주소 좀 알려주세요.
English: Please tell me the internet address.

Korean: #아마존#에 찾아보면 많이 나올 거에요.
English: You should be able to find a lot of them on #Amazon#.

Korean: 에어프라이어를 찾고 있는데 볼 수 있을까요?
English: I am looking for an air-fryer. Can I see one?

Korean: 바로 옆 코너에 있습니다.
English: It's in the section right next to you.

Korean: 어떤 점 때문에 많이 구매하나요?
English: Why do many people buy it?

Korean: 손쉽게 튀김 요리를 할 수 있어서 인기가 많습니다.
English: It's popular because you can easily make fried dishes.

Korean: 이 사진과 똑같은 옷을 사고 싶은데 남아있나요?
English: I would like to buy the same clothes as this photograph. Are there any left?

Korean: 그 제품은 5월부터 판매중단이 되어서 현재 없습니다. 대신 다른 상품은 어떠세요?
English: We do not have that product now as it has been discontinued since May. How about another product?

Korean: 나쁘지 않은데 생각한 물품이 없어서 아쉽네요.
English: It's not bad but I am disappointed that the product I was looking for is not here.

Korean: 도와드릴 방법이 없네요.
English: There is nothing I can do to help.

Korean: 제 남동생이 토이 스토리의 버즈 인형을 갖고 싶다는 데 여기에 있을까요?
English: My younger brother wants to get a #Buzz# doll from #Toy Story#. Do you sell it here?

Korean: 마침 어제 새로 들어왔어요.
English: It just came in yesterday.

Korean: 좋은 소식이에요. 깜짝 선물해줄 수 있을 거 같아요.
English: That's good news. I should be able to give it to him as a surprise gift.

Korean: 다양하게 있으니 천천히 둘러보세요.
English: Please take your time as there is a large variety.

Korean: 집에 리모컨이 고장 났어요. 똑같은 리모컨을 살 수 있을까요?
English: My remote control at home has broken. Can I buy the same remote?

Korean: 그 제품은 저희 매장에는 없습니다.
English: That product is not in our store.

Korean: 다른 가게에도 없을까요?
English: Would it be in other stores?

Korean: 다른 직원에게 물어보고 올 테니 잠깐 기다려 줄 수 있을까요?
English: Could you wait a moment while I go ask another employee?

Korean: 낚시하려고 왔는데 지렁이를 깜빡했어요. 여기에도 파나요?
English: I came to go fishing but I forget to bring worms. Do you sell them here?

Korean: 물론입니다. 한 박스에 10,000원입니다.
English: Of course. They are 10,000 won per box.

Korean: 생각보다 비싸네요.
English: That's more expensive than I expected.

Korean: 그만큼 지렁이가 많이 있습니다. 후회하지 않을 거예요.
English: It has that much more worms. You'll not regret it.

Korean: 기타 줄이 끊어졌어요. 혹시 여기에 똑같은 줄이 있을까요?
English: My guitar string broke. Do you happen to have the same one available?

Korean: 찾아봐야 할 것 같아요. 기타를 보여주세요.
English: I would have to look for it. Can you show me the guitar?

Korean: 기타를 산 지 5년이 되어서 없을 것 같아 걱정이에요.
English: I am worried that it won't be available as it has been 5 years since I bought this guitar.

Korean: 다행히 여기 있습니다. 서비스로 교체 도와드릴게요.
English: Luckily it's here. I'll swap it for you free of charge.

Korean: 욕실에서 넘어지지 않도록 하는 스티커가 필요합니다. 제가 찾는 중인데 안보이네요.
English: I need a sticker to prevent falling in the bathroom. I am looking for one, but I can't seem to find it.

Korean: 그 스티커는 한 층 아래로 내려가야 합니다.
English: You need to go down 1 floor for those stickers.

Korean: 없을 줄 알고 실망했는데 다행이에요.
English: That is a relief as I was disappointed because I thought they weren't here.

Korean: 에스컬레이터 타고 한 층 내려가야 합니다. 그리고 오른쪽으로 돌면 바로 보일 거예요.
English: You need to take the escalator and go down 1 floor. Then you should be able to see it directly when you turn to your right.

Korean: 차량용 휴대전화 충전기를 찾고 있습니다. 오래된 제품인데 있을까요?
English: I am looking for a cell phone charger for cars. Would it be here even though this is an old model?

Korean: 대부분 충전기는 똑같기 때문에 있을 거예요. 휴대전화 잠깐 볼게요.
English: We should have it as most chargers are the same. Let me see your phone for a minute.

Korean: 차를 타고 이동할 일이 많아서 꼭 필요해요.
English: I really need it because I move around a lot in my car.

Korean: 저기 있네요. 종류는 한 가지밖에 없습니다.
English: There it is. There is only one type.

Korean: 제가 자주 쓰는 파운데이션이 없어진다는 소식을 들었어요. 남아있는 제품이 있나요?
English: I heard the news that the foundation that I use often will be discontinued. Are they any products left?

Korean: 지금 어두운 색상밖에 남아있지 않아요.
English: We only have dark colors now.

Korean: 똑같은 파운데이션이 나오지 않는 건가요?
English: Does this mean that the same foundation will not be sold anymore?

Korean: 기존의 제품보다 더 촉촉하게 바뀌어서 나올 것 같아요.
English: We think it will be renewed with more moisturizing property compared to the existing product.

Korean: 이 시계가 마음에 드는 데 혹시 착용해볼 수 있을까요?
English: We like this watch and would like to know if we could try it on.

Korean: 어느 분이 착용할 건가요?
English: Who is the person who will be trying it on?

Korean: 접니다. 체인은 마음대로 조절할 수 있나요?
English: Me. Can the chain be adjusted as I please?

Korean: 물론이죠. 그리고 1년 이내에는 무상 수리가 가능합니다.
English: Of course. Free repairs are also available for 1 year.

Korean: 이 옷이 저한테 어울리는지, 사이즈가 맞는지 입어 보아도 될까요?
English: Can I try on these clothes to see if I look good in them and if they are the right size?

Korean: 탈의실에 가서 입어보시면 됩니다.
English: You can try them on in the fitting room.

Korean: M 사이즈로 주세요.
English: Please give me a size M.

Korean: 이 옷은 크게 나와서 제가 봤을 때는 S로 해도 될 것 같아요.
English: This piece of clothing was made a bit large, so I think a small size should be fine.

Korean: 이 반지 디자인이 마음에 들어요. 바로 살 수 있을까요?
English: I like the design of this ring. Can I buy it right now?

Korean: 남아있는 사이즈가 이것밖에 없어서 안 맞으면 주문하셔야 합니다.
English: We only have this size left so if it doesn't fit you will have to order it.

Korean: 착용해봐도 될까요?
English: Can I try it on?

Korean: 물론이죠. 보통 2번째나 4번째 손가락에 많이 합니다.
English: Of course. Usually, people put it on the index or ring finger.

Korean: 디퓨저 향을 맡을 수 있을까요?
English: Can I smell the fragrance of the diffusers?

Korean: 물론입니다. 마음에 드는 향 말씀하시면 제가 보여드리겠습니다.
English: Sure. If you tell me which scent you like, I will show it to you.

Korean: 그러면 라일락 향이랑 화이트 머스크 두 개 보여주세요.
English: Then please show me the 2 of them, the lilac and white musk scents.

Korean: 둘 다 인기가 많은 제품이에요.
English: Both are popular products.

Korean: 저는 스니커즈를 보고 있어요. 저기 신어볼 수 있나요?
English: I am looking at sneakers. Can I try them on?

Korean: 여기 앉아보세요. 사이즈는 얼마로 드릴까요?
English: Please sit here. What size should I get you?

Korean: 240으로 주세요.
English: Please give me a size 240.

Korean: 착화감도 편하고, 신었을 때도 예쁠 거예요.
English: It should feel comfortable and look good when you put them on.

Korean: 진열된 가방이 예쁘네요. 저 가방 제가 들어볼 수 있을까요?
English: The bags on display are pretty. Can I try holding that bag?

Korean: 네. 여기 거울 앞에서 한 번 보세요.
English: Yes. Please come look in front of this mirror.

Korean: 생각보다 무게가 가볍네요. 얼마입니까?
English: It is lighter than expected. How much is it?
It's 500 thousand won.

Korean: 요즈음 태블릿 PC로 작업을 많이 하더군요. 저는 아이패드를 보고 싶은데 어디에 있나요?
English: Nowadays many people work on tablet PCs. I would like to see some #Ipads#. Where are they?

Korean: 여기 있습니다. 최근 것부터 1년 전 상품까지 있어요.
English: Here they are. We have the latest products to ones from a year ago.

Korean: 직접 만져봐도 되나요?
English: Can I try it myself?

Korean: 물론입니다. 옆에 있는 터치펜으로도 사용 가능합니다.
English: Of course. You can also use it with the touch pen on the side.

Korean: 여행할 때 쓸 카메라를 사고 싶어요. 가벼우면서 화질이 좋은 카메라는 어디 있나요?
English: I want to buy a camera to use while traveling. Do you have a camera that is light and has a good image quality?

Korean: 바로 뒤에 있습니다. 색상도 다양합니다.
English: It's right behind you. It is also available in various colors.

Korean: 카메라로 사진 찍어봐도 되나요?
English: Can I try taking a photo with the camera?

Korean: 이 카메라는 손님에게 보여주는 용도라서 사진이 찍히지 않습니다.
English: This camera is a demo product for potential customers, so it doesn't take photos.

Korean: 캡 모자를 사고 싶은데 직접 머리에 써도 되나요?
English: I would like to buy a cap, could I try it on my head?

Korean: 화장품이 묻지 않게 조심해주세요.
English: Please be careful not to get make-up on it.

Korean: 제 머리가 큰 건가요? 모자가 작아요.
English: Is my head too big? The hat is too small.

Korean: 모자 뒤에 있는 끈으로 크기 조절할 수 있어요.
English: You can adjust the size with the strap in the back of the hat.

Korean: 소파에 직접 앉아서 확인해봐도 되나요?
English: Can I try the sofas by sitting on them?

Korean: 물론입니다. 앉아보면 어떤 소파가 좋은지 알 수 있을 거예요.
English: Of course. You should be able to tell which sofa is good by sitting on it.

Korean: 디자인이 예뻐도 불편한 소파가 있어서 확인이 필요해요.
English: I need to check because there are sofas that have a nice design but are uncomfortable.

Korean: 지금 앉아본 소파는 어떤가요?
English: How is the sofa that you are sitting on?

Korean: 식당에서 사용할 오븐을 찾고 있어요. 열어서 확인해봐도 될까요?
English: I'm looking for an oven to use in a restaurant. Can I open it to check?

Korean: 가능합니다. 작동은 안 되고 있어요.
English: You can. It's not working now.

Korean: 그렇군요. 이게 오븐 중에 베스트 상품인가요?
English: I see. Is this the best product in ovens?

Korean: 가격도 괜찮고 사용도 편리해서 많이 사용합니다.
English: Many people use it because it has a reasonable price and it's easy to use.

Korean: 어머니 선물로 스카프를 드리려고 합니다. 제가 착용해도 될까요?
English: I would like to give my mother a scarf as a present. Can I try it on?

Korean: 제가 직접 묶어드릴게요.
English: I'll tie it for you.

Korean: 발랄해 보이네요. 어른들은 이런 색상 좋아하시나요?
English: It looks very lively. Do older people like this color?

Korean: 이런 밝은 색상들은 30대 여성분들이 좋아하세요. 나이가 좀 있다면 이런 색상은 어떠세요?
English: Women in their 30s usually like bright colors like this one. How about this color if she is a bit older?

Korean: 우산을 직접 펴서 디자인을 보고 싶어요.
English: I would like to open the umbrella to see its design.

Korean: 확인한 후 처음처럼 해 놓으면 문제없습니다.
English: That's no problem as long as you put it back as it was after you examine it

Korean: 이 디자인이 귀엽네요. 똑같은 디자인에 어두운 색상은 없나요?
English: This design is cute. Is there the same design in a darker color?

Korean: 밝은 색상밖에 남지 않았어요.
English: We only have bright colors left.

Korean: 귀걸이 종류가 많네요. 거울에 비춰봐도 될까요?
English: You have many types of earrings. Can I try them on in front of a mirror?

Korean: 착용 가능합니다. 착용 후에 저에게 말씀해주세요.
English: You can put them on. Please tell me after you have tried them.

Korean: 그냥 돌려주면 되나요?
English: Is it ok just to give them to you?

Korean: 다시 세척해서 진열하고 있어서 저에게 돌려주셔야 합니다.
English: We clean them before displaying them again, so you need to give them back to me.

Korean: 안경테를 둘러봐도 될까요? 원하는 디자인 착용할 수 있습니까?
English: Can I have a look at frames for glasses? Can I try on designs that I like?

Korean: 말씀하시면 꺼내드리겠습니다.
English: I'll take them out for you if you ask.

Korean: 여기 있는 와인색 테두리 안경 보여주세요.
English: Please show me the glasses with the wine color frame.

Korean: 그 제품은 지금 50% 할인 중입니다.
English: That product is currently 50 percent off.

Korean: 여름맞이해서 선글라스를 구매하려고 합니다. 저기 있는 선글라스 착용해보고 싶어요.
English: I want to buy sunglasses to prepare for summer. I would like to try on those sunglasses there.

Korean: 제가 닦아서 드릴게요.
English: I will clean it for you.

Korean: 테두리가 두꺼운 게 마음에 드네요. 렌즈 색깔도 제가 고를 수 있나요?
English: I like that it has a thick frame. Can I also choose the lens color?

Korean: 대부분 검은색으로 많이 합니다. 그 외에 와인색, 갈색이 있습니다.
English: Most people choose black. Other colors include wine and brown.

Korean: 에센스랑 크림을 테스트할 수 있을까요? 제 피부가 예민해서요.
English: Can I test the essence and cream? I have sensitive skin.

Korean: 여기 앉아주세요. 화장 지우고 해야 하는 데 괜찮으세요?
English: Please sit here. You need to clean off your make-up to do so. Is that ok?

Korean: 문제없습니다.
English: No problem.

Korean: 여기 있는 솜으로 화장 지워주세요.
English: Please remove your make-up using the cotton here.

Korean: 매번 안경만 써서 렌즈를 착용할 줄 몰라요. 여기서 착용하는 방법 알려주면 안 되나요?
English: I always wore glasses, so I don't know how to wear contacts. Can you teach me how to put them in here?

Korean: 그렇다면 당연히 알려드리죠.
English: Of course, we would glad to teach you.

Korean: 세척액도 따로 구매해야 하나요?
English: Do I need to buy cleaning fluids separately?

Korean: 서비스로 드릴게요. 제 맞은편에 앉아주세요.
English: I give one to you for free. Please sit on the opposite side.

Korean: 등산용 자전거가 따로 있던데, 이 상품인가요?
English: I understand that there is a separate type of bicycle for mountain climbing. Is this it?

Korean: 여기서부터 저기까지입니다.
English: They are from here to there.

Korean: 혹시 직접 탑승해봐도 되나요?
English: Can I try riding it?

Korean: 네. 말씀해주시면 꺼내드릴게요.
English: Yes. I'll bring them out when you tell me.

Korean: 부부가 함께 오셨네요. 누가 탈 건가요?
English: I see you have come together as a couple. Who will be driving?

Korean: 제 아내가 타려고 합니다. 탑승할 수 있나요?
English: My wife will. Can we try sitting on them?

Korean: 물론입니다. 짧은 거리도 주행 가능합니다.
English: Of course. You can even test drive them for short distances.

Korean: 미리 생각하고 온 자동차가 있는데 #제네시스#로 볼 수 있을까요?
English: There is a car that we had thought about beforehand. Can we see #Genesis#?

Korean: #엠마 스톤#이 착용한 시계군요. 고가라고 들었습니다.
English: That's the watch that #Emma Stone# wore. I heard it's expensive.

Korean: 맞습니다. 디자인이 예쁘고 소비자 과실이 아니라면 3년 동안 무상 수리됩니다.
English: That's right. It has a pretty design and it can be repaired for free for 3 years if the damages are not caused by customers.

Korean: 제가 한 번 착용해봐도 될까요?
English: Can I try putting it on?

Korean: 네. 직접 착용해드리겠습니다. 조심히 다뤄주세요.
English: Yes. I will put it on for you. Please be careful with it.

Korean: 본 품을 사기 전에 테스트용으로 써보고 싶어요.
English: I would like to test this product before I buy it.

Korean: 저희 홈페이지에 들어가서 테스트하고 싶은 물건 선택하시면 샘플을 받아볼 수 있습니다.
English: You can receive a sample if you go to our homepage and select the product you wish to test.

Korean: 집으로 배달되나요?
English: Will it be delivered to my home?

Korean: 네. 대신 배송비가 2,000원 들어요.
English: Yes. But it costs 2,000 won for the delivery fee.

Korean: 손목이 너무 안 좋아서 손목 보호대를 사야 할 것 같아요.
English: I think I need to buy a wrist protector as I have a poor wrist condition.

Korean: 손목 보호대는 여기를 쭉 따라가면 있습니다.
English: Wrist protectors can be found by going straight through here.

Korean: 혹시 직접 착용해볼 수 있어요?
English: Can I try them on in person?

Korean: 죄송하지만 착용은 할 수 없습니다.
English: I am sorry but you cannot try them on.

Korean: 집에 아기가 있어서 가습기를 사고 싶어요. 상품을 둘러보고 싶은데 어디로 가야 합니까?
English: I want to buy a humidifier because I have a baby at home. Where should I go as I would like to have a look at the products?

Korean: 저를 따라오세요. 여기에 다양하게 있습니다.
English: Please follow me. There are various items here.

Korean: 사용해볼 수 있나요?
English: Can I try them?

Korean: 저기에 진열된 상품만 테스트해볼 수 있습니다.
English: You can only try the products that are on display over there,

Korean: 아기용 헤어밴드가 있나요?
English: Do you have hairbands for babies?

Korean: 왼쪽은 성인용 헤어밴드, 오른쪽은 유아용 헤어밴드입니다.
English: The ones on the left are hairbands for adults, and the ones on the right are hairbands for babies.

Korean: 직접 써봐도 될까요?
English: Can I try them on?

Korean: 유아용만 가능합니다.
English: You can try on only the ones for babies.

Korean: #다이슨# 청소기가 할인한다고 들었습니다. 어디에서 볼 수 있나요?
English: I heard that #Dyson# vacuum cleaners are on sale. Where can I see them?

Korean: 2층에 가면 있습니다.
English: They are on the 2nd floor.

Korean: 모든 #다이슨# 청소기가 할인된 가격으로 제공되나요?
English: Are all #Dyson# vacuum cleaners on sale?

Korean: 신제품을 제외하고 최대 30% 할인을 제공하고 있습니다.
English: We are giving up to 30 percent discount on all vacuums except for new releases.

Korean: 과일 행사가 있다고 들었어요. 과일 코너는 어디에 있습니까?
English: I heard there is a promotion on fruits. Where is the fruit section?

Korean: 바로 뒤에 있습니다. 행사하는 과일은 정해져 있어요.
English: It is right behind you. The sale is limited to certain fruits.

Korean: 어떤 과일이 있나요? 수박도 하나요?
English: What fruits are available? Are watermelons on sale?

Korean: 수박, 바나나, 참외만 행사하고 있어요.
English: Promotions are available only on watermelons, bananas, and Korean melons.

Korean: 휴대전화 케이스를 1개 가격에 2개를 살 수 있다고 들었어요.
English: I heard that I could buy two phone cases for the price of one.

Korean: 맞습니다. 여기 있는 상품 중에 2 개 고르시면 됩니다.
English: That is correct. You only need to select two products from the ones here.

Korean: 그럼 가격이 어떻게 되나요?
English: Then how much is it?

Korean: 2개에 10,000원입니다.
English: They are 10,000 won for two.

Korean: 여름 행사로 선풍기를 세일한다고 들었어요.
English: I heard there is a sale on fans as a summer promotion.

Korean: 맞습니다. 40% 할인해서 47,000원에 판매하고 있어요.
English: That's correct. We are selling them for 47,000 won which is a 40 percent discount.

Korean: 어디에서 상품을 볼 수 있나요?
English: Where can I see the products?

Korean: 7층 전자제품 판매대에 가면 있습니다.
English: You can find them in the stand for electronics on the 7th floor.

Korean: 여기 있는 책가방은 세일하나요?
English: Is this backpack here for sale?

Korean: 최대 30% 할인된 가격으로 드립니다.
English: We're selling them with a maximum discount of 30 percent.

Korean: 군청색의 책가방은 얼마 하나요?
English: How much is the navy-blue backpack?

Korean: 30,000원입니다. 현재 2개 남아있어요.
English: It is 30,000 won. There are currently 2 left.

Korean: #구찌# 핸드백도 할인하나요?
English: Are #Gucci# handbags also on sale?

Korean: 아닙니다. 대신 #프라다# 가방은 할인하고 있어요.
English: No. However, #Prada# bags are on sale.

Korean: 직원이 들고 있는 이 가방은 얼마 하나요?
English: How much is this bag that the employee is holding?
It's 530,000 won. It was 1,090,000 won originally.

Korean: 백화점 내에 있는 카카오 프렌즈 상품이 할인한다고 들었어요.
English: I heard that #Kakao Friends# products in the department store are on sale.

Korean: 지하 2층 에스컬레이터 옆에 있습니다.
English: They are next to the escalator on floor B2.

Korean: 저기 보이네요! 상품 고르고 나면 결제는 어디서 하나요?
English: I see them! Where do I pay for the products after I have selected them?

Korean: 여기서 하시면 됩니다.
English: You can do that here.

Korean: 최근에 광고에 나온 세탁세제를 찾고 있어요. 여기 매장에 있나요?
English: I am looking for the laundry detergent that was in the advertisement recently. Is it in this store?

Korean: B 코너에 가면 있습니다.
English: It is in section B.

Korean: 혹시 할인하고 있어요?
English: Is it on discount by chance?

Korean: 현재 신제품 기념으로 세일하고 있어요.
English: It is currently on sale to celebrate the new release.

Korean: 작은 선반을 찾고 있어요. 카페 내벽에 걸 수 있나요?
English: I am looking for a small shelf. Could I hang it on an interior wall of a caf??

Korean: 사람들이 인테리어로 많이 찾고 있네요. 오른쪽에 있어요.
English: Many people are asking for it to use it as interior design. It's on the right.

Korean: 가격은 얼마나 하나요?
English: How much is it?

Korean: 선반 한 개에 25,000원입니다.
English: It's 25,000 won for one shelf.

Korean: #닥터 드레#에서 나온 무선 헤드폰 재고 남아있나요?
English: Do you have any wireless headphones from #Dr. Dre# still in stock?

Korean: 신제품이 나와서 그 제품은 행사하고 있어요.
English: A new product has been released so there is a promotion on that one.

Korean: 정말요? 얼마나 할인하나요?
English: Really? How much is the discount?

Korean: 현재 30% 할인된 가격으로 제공하고 있습니다.
English: Currently, we are providing them with a 30 percent discount.

Korean: 정가로 골프 옷을 사기에는 부담스럽네요. 할인하는 상품은 없나요?
English: It is a bit burdensome to buy golf clothes at their original prices. Are there any products on sale?

Korean: 신제품을 제외하고 상의는 40% 할인하고 있습니다.
English: Tops are 40 percent off excluding new releases.

Korean: 그럼 이 상품은 새로 나왔나요?
English: Then has this product been newly released?

Korean: 아니에요. 그건 40% 할인되었습니다.
English: No. You'll get a 40 percent discount.

Korean: 립스틱 낱개 말고 여러 개 세트로 구매할 수는 없나요?
English: Can I buy multiple lipsticks as a set rather than individually?

Korean: 세트로 하면 색상이 정해져 있어요. 대신 가격은 저렴해집니다.
English: If you choose a set the colors are fixed. But it's cheaper.

Korean: 얼마나 저렴하나요?
English: How much cheaper?

Korean: 세 개 낱개로 사는 것보다 10,000원 저렴해집니다.
English: They are 10,000 won cheaper than buying three individual items.

Korean: 블라우스 가격이 70,000원인데 할인은 안 되나요?
English: The price of this blouse is 70,000 won. Is it possible to get a discount?

Korean: 적혀있는 가격에서 30% 할인됩니다.
English: There is a 30 percent discount from the listed price.

Korean: 다른 블라우스는 없나요?
English: Do you have other blouses?

Korean: 여기에 진열된 상품을 보면 됩니다. 대신 할인하는 상품이라 사이즈가 없는 것도 있어요.
English: You can look at the products displayed here. However, there some with unavailable sizes as they are discounted products,

Korean: 안내 책자에서 이 상품이 할인된다고 되어있던 데 어디서 살 수 있나요?
English: The brochure stated that this product was on sale so where can I buy it?

Korean: 제품은 2층에 있습니다만 행사가 끝났습니다.
English: The product is on the 2nd floor but the promotion has ended.

Korean: 오늘까지가 아닌가요?
English: Wasn't it until today?

Korean: 어제가 마지막 날이었습니다. 지금은 정가로 판매하고 있어요.
English: Yesterday was the last day. Currently, it is being sold at its list price.

Korean: 이사하는 가족들을 위해 가구가 세일한다고 들었어요.
English: I heard that there was a sale on furniture for families that are moving.

Korean: 맞습니다. 이사하는 날짜와 주소를 알려주시면 최대 50% 세일한 가격으로 제공합니다.
English: That is right. We provide up to 50 percent discount if you tell us the date of your move and your new address.

Korean: 어떤 가구나 다 해당하나요?
English: Does it apply to all furniture?

Korean: 제품마다 조금씩 차이가 있어서 직원에게 문의해봐야 합니다.
English: You need to ask an employee as it differs by product.

Korean: 머리 트리트먼트가 필요합니다. 유명한 제품이 여기에서만 판매한다고 들었습니다.
English: I need some hair treatment. I heard that the famous product is only sold here.

Korean: 날짜를 잘 맞춰서 오셨네요. 현재 3개 사면 2개 가격으로 드리고 있습니다.
English: You were lucky to come today. Currently, we are providing 3 products for the price of 2.

Korean: 한 개 사면 따로 할인은 안 되나요?
English: Is there a separate discount if I just buy one?

Korean: 죄송하지만 할인이 없습니다.
English: I am sorry but there is no such discount.

Korean: 한국에서는 똑같은 제품이 가격이 비싼데 여기는 저렴하네요.
English: The same product is expensive in Korea but it's cheap here.

Korean: 지금 보시는 가격에서 10% 할인도 됩니다.
English: You can also get a 10 percent discount from the price you see here.

Korean: 그럼 2개를 사야겠어요. 개수에는 제한이 없는가요?
English: Then I should get 2. Is there any limit on the number I can buy?

Korean: 없습니다. 그러면 결제 도와드리겠습니다.
English: There isn't. I'll help you with the payment then.

Korean: 20주년 된 기념으로 전 제품 할인하고 있어!
English: All products are on sale to commemorate their 20th anniversary!

Korean: 정말이네. 필요했던 다리미를 사야겠어..
English: You are right. I should buy that iron I needed.

Korean: 안내에 보니깐 가전제품은 한 층 아래로 가야 한다고 적혀있어.
English: Looking at the information it says that we need to go down 1 floor for electronics.

Korean: 같이 가보자. 직원에게 가격도 물어봐야겠어.
English: Let’s go together. I should also go ask an employee about prices.

Korean: 벌써 장마네요. 비가 많이 내려서 우산이랑 장화를 사고 싶어요. 어디에 있을까요?
English: It is already a monsoon season. I want to buy an umbrella and boots because it's raining so much. Where could they be?

Korean: 1층 입구에 양산 옆에 우산 판매하고 있어요.
English: Umbrellas are sold next to the parasols at the entrance of the 1st floor.

Korean: 할인하고 있나 보네요. 가격표에 줄이 빨갛게 그어져 있네요.
English: It looks like it's on sale. There is a red line through the price tag.

Korean: 맞아요. 정확한 가격은 가격표를 찍어봐야 알 수 있어요.
English: That is correct. We need to scan the price tag to get the actual price.

Korean: 할인된 상품을 구매했는데 정가로 결제가 되었어요.
English: I bought a discounted product but was charged the full price.

Korean: 저는 결제만 해서 잘 모르겠어요. 직원 불러서 확인해야 할 것 같아요.
English: I am not sure as I only handle payments. I think I need to call an employee to confirm.

Korean: 상품 아래에 적힌 가격 보고 골랐는데, 제가 상품을 잘못 고른 건가요?
English: I selected it based on the price below the product. Did I choose the wrong one?

Korean: 오늘부터 할인이 적용되어서 전산에 오류가 있었네요. 다시 결제 도와드릴게요.
English: There was a computing error because the discount was applied today. I will help you with your payment again.

Korean: 아기 기저귀가 오늘까지 할인하는 것 맞나요?
English: Is it correct that the baby diapers are on sale only until today?

Korean: 맞습니다. 20% 할인하고 있어요.
English: That's right. They are on a 20 percent discount.

Korean: 어디서 찾을 수 있나요? 제 눈에는 보이지 않아서요.
English: Where can I find them? I can't seem to see them.

Korean: 분유 옆 코너에 있어요.
English: They are in the section next to the powdered milk section.

Korean: 할인한다는 한우는 어디에 있나요?
English: Where is Korean beef that is supposed to be on sale?

Korean: 고기 판매하는 코너에 가면 행사 제품이 크게 적혀있어요.
English: There is a large sign with the discounted products when you go to the section selling meat.

Korean: 감사합니다. 사람들이 많이 있나요?
English: Thank you. Is it crowded?

Korean: 1시간 전에는 많이 있었어요. 그 뒤로는 안 가봐서 모르겠네요.
English: It was packed 1 hour ago. I haven't been there after that, so I don't know.

Korean: 공기청정기를 구매하고 싶은데 저렴하게 구매할 수 있을까요?
English: I want to buy an air purifier. Is there a way to buy an affordable one?

Korean: 이번에 삼성에서 나온 제품이 30% 할인하고 있어요.
English: This time there is a 30 percent discount for a product from #Samsung#.

Korean: 최근에 나온 모델인가요?
English: Is it a newly released model?

Korean: 작년 7월에 나온 제품이에요.
English: It's a product that was released last July.

Korean: 작년에 나온 전자제품 중에 50% 할인하는 품목이 있지 않나요?
English: Aren't there items that are on a 50 percent discount from the electronics that came out last year?

Korean: 다른 품목은 다 팔렸고 현재 TV만 남아있어요.
English: All other items have been sold so there are only TVs remaining.

Korean: 저는 벽걸이 TV 원하는 데 그 상품도 50% 할인합니까?
English: I want a wall-mounted TV. Is that product also 50 percent off?

Korean: 지금 하나 남아있어요. 물론 할인도 합니다.
English: There is one left right now. Of course, it's on sale.

Korean: 여기는 다른 매장보다 30% 저렴하게 아동 놀이 용품을 판매한다고 들었어요.
English: I heard this store sells children's toys 30 percent cheaper than other stores.

Korean: 맞습니다. 2층에 가면 놀이 용품이 종류별로 있어요.
English: You're correct. There are various types of toys if you go to the second floor.

Korean: 감사합니다. 혹시 현금으로만 결제해야 하나요?
English: Thank you. Do I need to pay only in cash?

Korean: 카드도 결제 가능합니다.
English: You can also pay with a credit card.

Korean: 미국 여행을 가려고 합니다. 3,000,000원 환전해주세요.
English: I'm planning to go on a trip to the States. Please exchange 3,000,000 won.

Korean: 우리 은행에서 환전하면 최대 50% 수수료 우대가 가능합니다.
English: If you exchange currencies at our bank, we can provide a maximum preferential commission of up to 50 percent.

Korean: 수수료를 적게 낸다는 말인가요?
English: Does that mean I pay less commission?

Korean: 수수료 우대가 클수록 지불하는 금액이 적어집니다.
English: The greater the preferential commission the smaller the amount of money you pay.

Korean: 홍콩 여행을 가면 지폐를 두 가지로 환전해야 한다고 들었습니다.
English: I heard that I need to exchange my money into two types of currencies when traveling in Hong Kong.

Korean: 저희는 중국 지폐 단위로만 환전할 수 있습니다.
English: We can only exchange bill denominations in Chinese currency.

Korean: 다른 한 가지는 어디서 환전할 수 있나요?
English: Where can I exchange the other currency?

Korean: 국내에서는 환전이 불가하다고 알고 있습니다. 홍콩에 가서 따로 환전해야 합니다.
English: My understanding is that such an exchange is not possible in Korea. You need to exchange it separately in Hong Kong.

Korean: 급하게 출장을 발령받아서 환전을 못 했습니다. 비행기 탑승하기 2시간 남았어요.
English: I was not able to exchange currencies because I was suddenly ordered on this business trip. I have 2 hours until my airplane boarding time.

Korean: 지금 빨리해드릴게요.
English: I'll do it for you right away.

Korean: 감사합니다. 500,000원만 부탁드릴게요.
English: Thank you. 500,000 won only, please.

Korean: 신분증 좀 보여주세요.
English: Please show me your identification.

Korean: 일본 여행을 가려고 합니다. 혹시 동전으로도 바꿀 수 있어요?
English: I am planning to go on a trip to Japan. Can I exchange coins as well?

Korean: 은행에서 환전하는 건 지폐로만 바꿔드립니다.
English: Currency exchanges at banks only exchange for bills.

Korean: 일본에는 동전을 많이 쓴다고 들었습니다.
English: I heard that they use a lot of coins in Japan.

Korean: 여행 중에 동전이 많이 생긴다고 들었습니다. 동전 지갑을 챙기는 게 좋을 것 같아요.
English: I heard that you will gain a lot of coins during your travels. I think it would be a good idea to take a coin wallet.

Korean: 여행자 수표를 현금으로 바꿔주세요.
English: Please exchange this traveler's check into cash.

Korean: 잠시만 기다려주세요. 금방 해드릴게요.
English: Please wait for a moment. I will do it right away.

Korean: 수수료는 얼마나 드나요?
English: How much is the commission?

Korean: 약 30,000원 나옵니다
English: It's about 30,000 won.

Korean: 원화 1,000,000원을 달러로 환전해주세요. 잔돈도 섞어주세요.
English: Please exchange 1 million won into dollars,  in various denominations, please.

Korean: 골고루 섞어드릴게요. 수수료는 추가로 결제해야 합니다.
English: I will divide them equally. You need to pay an additional commission.

Korean: 수수료 80% 우대할 수 있는 쿠폰을 가지고 있습니다.
English: I have a coupon for an 80 percent preferential commission rate.

Korean: 사용 불가능한 쿠폰이라고 하네요. 지난달까지만 사용 가능했어요.
English: They say this coupon cannot be used. It was only valid until last month.

Korean: 은행이 어디 있나요? 급하게 환전을 해야 해서요.
English: Where is the bank? I need to quickly exchange currencies.

Korean: 오른쪽으로 쭉 가면 있습니다. 빨리 가보세요. 사람들이 많이 기다리고 있었어요.
English: It's straight ahead to your right. Go quickly. There are a lot of people waiting.

Korean: 다른 은행은 없나요?
English: Is there any other bank?

Korean: 공항 내 은행은 한 곳밖에 없습니다.
English: There is only one bank in the airport.

Korean: 얼마나 환전하실 건가요?
English: How much do you want to exchange?

Korean: 400유로로 환전하려고 합니다. 환율이 어떤가요?
English: I want to exchange for 400 euros. What is the exchange rate?

Korean: 1유로는 현재 원화로 약 1,300원입니다.
English: 1 euro is currently about 1,300 won.

Korean: 많이 올랐네요. 최대한 잔돈을 많이 주세요.
English: It increased a lot. Please give me as much small change as you can.

Korean: 다른 은행에 갔더니 잔돈이 없다고 해서 여기로 왔습니다.
English: I came here because the other bank said they did not have small change.

Korean: 마침 해당 은행에서 전화가 왔었어요. 바로 환전 도와드릴게요.
English: I just received the call from that bank. I'll help exchange your money right away.

Korean: 감사합니다. 당연히 바꿀 수 있을 줄 알았어요.
English: Thank you. I was certain I would be able to exchange the money.

Korean: 은행마다 보유할 수 있는 금액이 달라서 미리 전화를 해봐야 합니다.
English: The amount that each bank can hold differs, so you need to call in advance.

Korean: 달러를 유로로 환전할 수 있나요?
English: Can I exchange dollars to euros?

Korean: 가능합니다. 얼마나 바꾸실 건가요?
English: You can. How much would you like the exchange?

Korean: 500달러입니다. 수수료는 얼마나 드나요?
English: 500 dollars. How much is the commission?

Korean: 현재 은행에서는 최대 수수료 50%를 우대해드리고 있어요.
English: Currently, we provide up to 50 percent discount on our commission.

Korean: 환전하려고 하는 데 수수료를 최대한 적게 내고 싶어요.
English: I want to exchange money and pay the least amount of commission.

Korean: 은행에서 직접 환전을 하는 것보다 애플리케이션으로 하면 최대로 우대받을 수 있습니다.
English: You can get the best rate if you do it through the app rather than exchanging it in the bank in person.

Korean: 제가 하는 방법을 모르는데 가르쳐줄 수 있을까요?
English: Could you teach me as I do not know how to do it?

Korean: 일단 은행 애플리케이션을 설치해주세요.
English: To start please install the bank application.

Korean: 지금 달러 환율이 얼마나 되나요?
English: What is the dollar exchange rate now?

Korean: 지금은 1달러가 원화로 1,200원입니다. 계속 상승하고 있어요.
English: Currently, 1 dollar is 1,200 won. It keeps on rising.

Korean: 한 달 뒤에 미국 여행을 갈 건데 계속 오를까요?
English: I am going on a trip to the U.S. in a month. Do you think it will keep rising?

Korean: 2주 뒤에 환율 확인한 후에 환전해도 괜찮을 것 같아요.
English: I think it would be ok to exchange currencies after checking the exchange rate in 2 weeks.

Korean: 상사가 너무 늦게 해외 출장을 알려주는 바람에 환전을 못 했어. 네가 나 대신에 환전해 줄 수 있니?
English: I wasn't able to exchange currencies because my boss was too late in informing me of my overseas business trip. Could you exchange it for me?

Korean: 얼마나 필요한데?
English: How much do you need?

Korean: 회사에서 지원금이 따로 있으니깐 350유로만 있으면 될 것 같아.
English: I receive separate funds from the company so I think 350 euros would be sufficient.

Korean: 알겠어. 그럼 내가 환전하고 다시 전화할게.
English: Ok. I'll exchange currencies and call you back.

Korean: 러시아에서 사용할 지폐로 환전하고 싶어요.
English: I would like to change currencies to bills that I can use in Russia.

Korean: 죄송하지만 러시아 돈은 환전이 불가합니다. 여기서 달러로 교환해서 러시아에 가야 합니다.
English: I'm sorry but we cannot exchange to Russian money. You need to exchange to dollars here and go to Russia.

Korean: 러시아에 가서 또 환전해야 하나요?
English: Do I need to exchange currencies again in Russia?

Korean: 그렇습니다. 은행이나 호텔에 가서 루블화로 환전해야 합니다.
English: That is right. You need to exchange your money to rubles in a bank or hotel.

Korean: 이 돈을 원화로 바꾸고 싶습니다.
English: I would like to exchange this money to won.

Korean: 죄송하지만 찢어졌거나 훼손된 지폐는 환전이 불가합니다.
English: I am sorry but we cannot exchange ripped or damaged bills.

Korean: 다른 은행도 똑같나요?
English: Is it the same for other banks?

Korean: 확실하지 않으나 비슷할 거예요.
English: I am not sure, but it should be similar.

Korean: 유로화를 원화로 환전하고 싶은데 현재 환율이 어떻게 되나요?
English: I would like to change euros to won. What is the current exchange rate?

Korean: 지금 원화로 바꾸면 손해가 큽니다. 급하게 원화가 필요하신 게 아니라면 가지고 있는 게 좋을 것 같습니다.
English: You will lose a lot if you change to won now. Unless you need won urgently, I think it would be best just to keep your money.

Korean: 집에 보관하다가 잃어버릴 것 같아서요.
English: I am afraid I would lose it if I keep it at home.

Korean: 외화통장을 만들어서 보관하는 건 어떤가요?
English: How about making and storing it in a foreign currency account?

Korean: 여행 후에 생긴 동전들을 환전하고 싶습니다.
English: I would like to exchange the coins I got on my trip.

Korean: 죄송하지만 환전은 지폐만 가능합니다.
English: I'm sorry but we can only exchange bills.

Korean: 이 동전들을 다 합하면 50달러는 될 것 같은데 환전이 안 되나요?
English: These coins are about 50 dollars. Is there no way to exchange them?

Korean: 동전은 환전하는 데 어려움이 있어 받지 않고 있습니다.
English: We do not accept coins as there are difficulties in exchanging them.

Korean: 들고 온 현금이 부족해서 추가로 환전하려고 합니다.
English: I will like to make an additional exchange since the cash I brought was not enough.

Korean: 문제 없습니다. 얼마나 환전하시겠어요?
English: No problem. How much would you like to exchange?

Korean: 일본 돈으로 3,000엔 환전해주세요.
English: Please exchange 3,000 yen in Japanese currency.

Korean: 신분증 확인할게요. 그리고 환전하는 금액을 이 종이에 적어주세요.
English: Let me check your identification. Please write down the exchange amount on this paper.

Korean: 제가 독일어를 할 줄 모릅니다. 환전하고 싶은데 영어 할 줄 아는 사람 있나요?
English: I do not know how to speak German. I would like to exchange money. Is there someone who speaks English?

Korean: 제 옆에 계신 분이 영어를 할 줄 알아요. 그녀가 저희 대화를 통역해줄 거예요.
English: The person next to me can speak English. She will translate our conversation.

Korean: 다행이군요. 다음 여행에는 독일어를 배워서 와야 할 것 같아요.
English: That is a relief. I think I need to learn German for my next trip.

Korean: 다음 방문 시에는 더 쉽게 여행할 수 있을 거예요.
English: You should be able to travel with more ease the next time you visit.

Korean: 이번에는 여행 전에 여유가 있어서 은행에서 환전하게 됐네요.
English: I came to exchange currencies at the bank because I have some time to spare before the trip this time.

Korean: 지난번에는 은행에서 환전을 못 했나 보네요.
English: It looks like you didn't get to exchange your money in a bank previously.

Korean: 매번 환전을 미리 못해서 공항에서 하거나 그 나라에 도착해서 바꿨어요.
English: I always exchanged currency at the airport or when I arrived in the country because I could not exchange it in advance.

Korean: 미리 은행에서 바꿔가면 조금 더 쉽고, 수수료가 적게 나가요.
English: If you exchange it in a bank in advance, it is easier, and you pay less commission.

Korean: 이제는 은행에 방문하지 않고도 환전할 수 있다고 들었어요.
English: I heard you can exchange currencies now without visiting a bank.

Korean: 새로 나온 애플리케이션으로 신청하는 방법이 있어요.
English: There is a way to apply through the newly launched app.

Korean: 신청하고 입금하면 은행에 와서 환전한 돈을 찾아가야 하지 않나요?
English: If I apply and transfer money, don't I have to come to the bank to pick up the money I changed?

Korean: 그 방법도 있지만, 3일 전에 신청하면 집으로 안전하게 배달됩니다.
English: There is that method, but if you apply 3 days in advance it is safely delivered to your home.

Korean: 생각보다 많은 사람이 공항에서 환전하네요.
English: More people than I expected change currencies at the airport.

Korean: 대부분 직장인이 공항의 환전소를 많이 이용합니다.
English: Most business people use the currency exchange at the airport a lot.

Korean: 그럼 환전은 빨리 되나요?
English: Then is the exchange process quick?

Korean: 사람이 많아서 기다리는 시간을 제외하면 10분밖에 안 걸립니다.
English: Excluding the time waiting when there is a lot of people, it only takes 10 minutes.

Korean: 제가 직장 때문에 은행에 갈 수가 없어요. 아들이 환전할 수 있나요?
English: I cannot go to the bank because of my work. Can my son change currencies?

Korean: 성인이라면 가능합니다.
English: He can if he is an adult.

Korean: 유학 때문에 필요한 돈인데 학생인 자녀가 가면 안 될까요?
English: It is money to study abroad, so is it possible for my son who is a student to go?

Korean: 18세 이상인 성인이 신분증을 들고 오셔야 환전할 수 있습니다.
English: Currencies can only be changed by an adult over 18 who brings their identification.

Korean: 여행에서 쓰고 남은 돈을 원화로 바꾸고 싶어요.
English: I would like to change the money left over from the trip to won.

Korean: 고객님께서 가지고 있는 돈은 위조지폐 같습니다.
English: It looks like the money you have is counterfeit.

Korean: 중국에서 마지막으로 사고 받은 잔돈이에요.
English: This is the spare change I received after my last purchase in China.

Korean: 벗겨진 은색 코팅을 살펴보니 의심스럽네요. 확인이 필요합니다.
English: I became suspicious after examining the peeled off silver coating. This needs to be checked.

Korean: 브라질에 가려고 합니다. 여기서 환전이 가능합니까?
English: I plan on going to Brazil. Can I exchange currencies here?

Korean: 안타깝지만 달러로만 환전할 수 있습니다.
English: Unfortunately, we can only exchange to dollars.

Korean: 달러 환율은 어떻게 되나요?
English: What is the dollar exchange rate?

Korean: 현재 올림픽 때문에 달러 환율이 상승하고 있습니다.
English: The dollar exchange rate is currently rising because of the Olympics.

Korean: 오늘 비가 많이 와서 야외 페스티벌 관람이 취소됐대.
English: Due to the heavy rain, the outdoor festival has been canceled today.

Korean: 그럴 것 같았어. 기대했던 페스티벌인데 아쉽다.
English: I thought so. I looked forward to this. What a bummer.

Korean: 매년 하는 페스티벌이니까 내년에 또 오자.
English: This festival is held every year, so we can come next year.

Korean: 그래. 내년에도 시간이 나야 할 텐데.
English: Okay then. I hope I have time next year.

Korean: 내일 유명한 마을 투어가 있는데 참여해볼래?
English: There's a famous town tour tomorrow. Do you want to go?

Korean: 응. 나야 좋지. 몇 시에 시작하는데?
English: Of course. When does it begin?

Korean: 조금 일찍 시작해. 아침 9시까지 역으로 가야 해.
English: It begins early. We have to go to the station by 9 a.m.

Korean: 아침 9시까지 가려면 시간이 빠듯하겠네.
English: That's a pretty tight schedule, to be there by 9 a.m.

Korean: 내일모레 호핑 투어를 예약했는데 확인하려고 전화했어요.
English: I made a reservation for the hopping tour the day after tomorrow.

Korean: 네, 전화번호 뒷자리 말씀해주시겠어요?
English: Okay. Could you tell me the last 4 digits of your phone number?

Korean: 1234입니다. 2명으로 예약했어요.
English: It's 1234, and the reservation is for 2 people.

Korean: 네, 확인되었습니다. 내일모레 오후 2시로 잡혀있어요.
English: Okay, it checks out. You're scheduled for 2 p.m. the day after tomorrow.

Korean: 밤 10시부터 호텔 앞에서 축제가 시작된대.
English: There will be a festival in front of the hotel from 10 p.m.

Korean: 10시? 9시부터 아니었어? 나는 그렇게 알고 있는데.
English: 10 p.m.? Isn't it from 9 p.m.? That's what I thought.

Korean: 호텔 측에 다시 전화해서 확인해봐야겠다.
English: Let me call the hotel again to check.

Korean: 응. 유명한 축제니까 시간 착각하면 절대 안 돼.
English: Okay. It's a popular festival so we cannot afford to make a mistake about the time.

Korean: 일본의 눈 축제는 몇 월부터 시작되는 거야?
English: When does the snow festival in Japan start?

Korean: 아마 1월 한 달 동안 계속하는 거로 알고 있어.
English: I think it starts in January and lasts through the month.

Korean: 그럼 1월 초로 비행기 예약을 하자.
English: Then let's book our flights for early January.

Korean: 12월 말에 예약하는 건 어때? 그때 비행기 삯이 저렴하대.
English: How about late December? The flights are cheaper then.

Korean: 우리 보기로 한 뮤지컬이 내일이지?
English: Is the musical we're supposed to see tomorrow?

Korean: 내일모레야. 해외에서 보는 뮤지컬이라니 정말 기대돼.
English: It's the day after tomorrow. I am so excited about our foreign musical.

Korean: 내일모레구나. 예매하느라 정말 힘들었어.
English: Oh, I see. It was very difficult getting the tickets, you know.

Korean: 이런 유명한 뮤지컬을 예매해줘서 정말 고마워!
English: Thank you so much for getting the tickets for such a famous musical!

Korean: 이번 여행에서 네가 말했던 빛 축제는 못 볼 것 같아.
English: I don't think we can go to the light festival you talked about.

Korean: 왜? 일정대로라면 충분히 볼 수 있지 않아?
English: Why not? Doesn't our schedule allow it?

Korean: 그러려고 했는데 가는 길이 너무 멀어서 시간이 없을 것 같아.
English: I thought so at first, but it's too far away so we don't have enough time.

Korean: 나는 그 축제를 제일 기대했는데. 다른 일정을 조절하면 안 될까?
English: I looked forward to that festival. Can we make changes to our other schedules?

Korean: 여행 계획을 짜볼까? 셋째 날에 전통 공연을 보러 가는 건 어때?
English: Should we plan our trip? How about going to a traditional performance on the 3rd day?

Korean: 그날은 토요일이라서 사람이 좀 몰릴 것 같아.
English: It's on Saturday so I think it'll be crowded.

Korean: 그러면 금요일에 보러 갈까? 대신 평일에는 조금 일찍 가야 해.
English: Then how about Friday? But we should leave earlier on weekdays.

Korean: 그래도 토요일보단 금요일이 더 나은 것 같아. 금요일에 가자.
English: I think Friday is better than Saturday. Let's leave on Friday.

Korean: 우리 내년에 갈 유럽 여행은 언제 어느 계절이 가장 좋을까?
English: When do you think is the best season for next year's Europe trip?

Korean: 유럽 여행이라면 여름에 가는 게 좋아. 날씨가 굉장히 좋거든.
English: I recommend Europe in summer. The weather is great.

Korean: 크리스마스 시즌에 가는 건 어때? 매우 많은 축제가 있다던데.
English: How about going during the Christmas season? There are many festivals.

Korean: 그것도 좋겠다. 정확한 크리스마스 축제 일정부터 알아보자.
English: That sounds good, too. Let's check out the exact Christmas festival schedules first.

Korean: 우리 셋째 날에 보러 가려고 했던 공연 예매했어?
English: Did you make reservations for the performance on the 3rd day?

Korean: 얘기하는 걸 깜박했네. 그날에는 매진이라서 그다음 날로 예매했어.
English: I forgot to tell you. It was sold out for that day so I made it to the next day.

Korean: 그런 건 미리미리 말해줘야지. 그다음 날은 자리가 많았어?
English: You should have told me that earlier. Were there enough tickets for the next day?

Korean: 아니. 넷째 날도 겨우 예매한 거야. 하마터면 못 볼 뻔했어.
English: No, I barely made it. We could have easily failed.

Korean: 공원이 4시까지만 열려있대. 벚꽃을 보러 갈 유일한 기회였는데.
English: The park is only open until 4. It was our only chance to see the cherry blossoms.

Korean: 공원은 당연히 저녁까지 열려있을 줄 알았는데. 정말 아쉽다.
English: I thought the park would be open until later. Too bad!

Korean: 앞으로는 일정 하나하나 다 확인해봐야겠어.
English: I should check every schedule thoroughly from now on.

Korean: 일단 내일 가는 곳들 영업시간을 알아보도록 하자.
English: Let's first check out the operation time for places we'll go tomorrow.

Korean: 방금 콘서트는 정말 재밌었어! 다음 일정은 뭐야?
English: The concert was just amazing! What's our next plan?

Korean: 다음 일정은 뮤지컬 관람이야. 연속으로 봐도 괜찮겠어?
English: It's a musical. Is it okay if we watch back to back?

Korean: 나야 좋지. 일정이 그렇게 밖에 안되니까 어쩔 수 없었잖아.
English: Of course. That was the only way for us to schedule it.

Korean: 우리가 여행 온 날짜에 맞춰서 둘 다 보려면 오늘밖에 안 되더라고.
English: Today was the only available time for us to watch the two shows.

Korean: 다음 일정은 뭐더라? 일정이 빡빡해서 기억이 잘 안 나네.
English: What was the next schedule again? The itinerary was too tight, so I can't remember.

Korean: 일정이 너무 많아서 내가 앱에 다 저장해놨어.
English: We had so many schedules so I saved them on the app.

Korean: 정말? 그 앱 나한테 한 번 보여주면 안 돼?
English: Really? Can you show me the app?

Korean: 응, 여기 있어. 다음은 마을 전통 축제 관람이야.
English: Sure, here you go. Next on the list is traditional town performance.

Korean: 동물원 가는 날은 언제더라? 판다를 빨리 보고 싶어.
English: When do we go to the zoo? I can't wait to see pandas.

Korean: 동물원은 넷째 날에 가기로 정했었잖아. 주말에는 사람이 너무 몰릴 것 같아서.
English: The zoo is on the 4th day. It's too packed during the weekends.

Korean: 그랬었지. 하긴 주말에는 아이들도 정말 많겠다.
English: Sure. I think there would be too many kids during the weekends.

Korean: 당연하지. 이 동물원의 판다들은 정말 유명하니까.
English: Right. The pandas at this zoo are really famous.

Korean: 내일 콘서트 보러 가는 날이니까 12시쯤에 출발하자.
English: Let's leave around 12 to see the concert.

Korean: 왜 그렇게 일찍 출발해? 콘서트는 5시에 시작하잖아.
English: Why so early? The concert begins at 5.

Korean: 콘서트 굿즈를 사려면 일찍 가서 줄을 서야 해.
English: We have to go early and get in line to buy concert goods.

Korean: 콘서트에서 굿즈들도 파는구나. 하지만 5시간씩이나 일찍 가야 해?
